data.title: A Little Corner of Happiness
data.text: I was downtown at a convention and decided that I would walk around to see what there was to eat. Black Horse was full, and Cloud 9 was not open for lunch.  I found myself at Kooka's Nest on Strawberry Alley, which if your walking by, you may not see. Kooka's Nest and the little coffee shop next door are technically separate places, but also open to each other, which is nice. I walked in and found a mini cafe is the only way to describe it. Think Starbucks, but with more of a DIY/Artsy vibe. The couple behind the counter and grille were so nice and friendly! I got the Grilled Chicken Quesadillas and sweet tea. There are only 4-5 tables, and the prices are pretty comparable. They would probably be great for to go orders, but I am not exactly sure if they do that. Great food and this is a little hidden gem! Give it a try! Great atmosphere, friendly owners/staff, yes it is small, but they do know how to cook! Also a great option if you don't want the everything is fried option when the  River's and Spires festival is going on as well as, if you are on diet and/or have specific diet specifications.

data.title: Tastebuds awakened.
data.text: I ate at this fine place last week and can't stop talking about it. When you first walk in, your greeted by a wonderful couple who know how to cook. I had a bowl of chili and a kookadog with sour kraut. The chili reminded me of a cool day in gods country. (Texas) as we finished up, they brought us a large sample of their chicken salad. DELICIOUS!!! Go spend your lunch hour on strawberry alley and try this place for yourself. You'll be back.

data.title: Broccoli salad!
data.text: Local owned business*** Great fresh food made daily and as ordered. The Broccoli salad is the best and the owner is always so fun and happy to be there. big supporter of Fire/EMS, great place/food/service

data.title: Good place for a quick bite
data.text: Cute little place with good food. Perfect for a quick lunch with friends. Limited seating inside, but if it's a nice day you can choose to eat al fresco.  The owner is a super nice guy and the servers are quick to check on you and get whatever you need.  It's a great place to stop in and grab lunch when shopping in downtown Clarksville.

data.title: A MUST GO for Clarksville!
data.text: I love everything about this place! The food is AMAZING and the service is always top notch. The owners are always so friendly and you feel like family just walking in. The chicken quesadilla is my favorite on the menu and there isn't a Mexican restaurant in town that can compete with it! I never use a menu because whatever I want they seem to have, or can make me something like it. It's a MUST go for Clarksville!

data.title: Great food, awesome service, reasonable prices
data.text: Had lunch with a friend today and it was fabulous. The double-decker BLT was excellent (not sure what kind of bacon they use, but it was very good and plentiful). My friend said the homemade pimento cheese was also very good. The homemade broccoli salad was a nice change to chips or other typical sides. Chocolate chip cookie was a great finish to the meal. Superb service by a very nice and professional APSU student. And... the first hour of parking is free downtown and the new meters allow you to add more time to the end of the hour.
